intro: Ilysanthes pulchella subsp. rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodesian velvetleaf, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and deep green color. It produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent red stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils in grasslands and woodland areas.
